Kane Williamson praised Glenn Phillips' remarkable performance under pressure
Daryl Mitchell praised Glenn Phillips' performance, calling it 'unbelievable'.
Michael Clarke criticized Sri Lanka's fielding, noting it cost them significantly.
Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka acknowledged areas for improvement, especially in fielding
Phillips mentioned his intention to entertain fans and enjoy the game as much as possible.
Glenn Phillips received medical attention after suffering cramps during Sri Lanka's innings.
Glenn Phillips expressed his happiness with his process and the team's all-round performance
Kane Williamson emphasized the importance of focusing on the next game and making adjustments
Phillips emphasized the overall team effort and the satisfaction of winning in a sticky situation.
Phillips praised his batting partner Daryl Mitchell for his belief and ability to handle tough situations.
Commentators praised Phillips' performance, with Mel Jones and Dale Steyn highlighting his phenomenal knock.
Stuart Clark remarked on the comprehensive nature of New Zealand's win and the impact of Glenn Phillips' innings
Dasun Shanaka applauded Glenn Phillips for his innings and mentioned that they lost too many wickets inside the Powerplay.
Phillips commented on the importance of running between the wickets and the intent to show presence, especially with Sri Lanka on top at that stage.
Kane Williamson mentioned that the wicket was very different from what he expected and praised Glenn Phillips and the bowlers for their performances.
Glenn Phillips expressed that this century was the most special innings of his short-form career so far, especially because it was on a World Cup stage.
Glenn Phillips: Me and Daryll were really clear we wanted to be as positive as possible. It's absolutely indescribable to score a century in a World Cup.
Glenn Phillips, the Player of the Match, mentioned that the plan with Daryl Mitchell was to build a partnership whilst being positive and praised the bowlers for their execution.
SL skipper Dasun Shanaka: We started really well, particularly in the first 10 overs. But credit to Glenn Phillips who played an outstanding knock. Boult and Southee bowled really well up front.
NZ skipper Kane Williamson: The wicket was different to what we were expecting. Glenn Phillips and Daryll Mitchell put together a partnership, and it was an incredible knock to get a very good total.
